Key Match Events: The White Sox scored 5 runs in the top of the 9th inning to defeat the Red Sox, 7-2.
Boston couldn't do anything substantial at the plate, going 0-for-6 with runners in scoring position.
Triston Casas made a costly fielding error in the 6th inning, leading to 2 White Sox runs and changing the momentum of the game.
Wilyer Abreu hit a solo homer in the 6th inning to tie the game at 2-2.
Connor Wong hit a solo homer in the 2nd inning to put the Red Sox ahead 1-0.
Pre-Game Insights: The Red Sox were looking to complete a three-game sweep of the White Sox, but ultimately came up short.
Manager Alex Cora emphasized the importance of staying in the Wild Card hunt, saying 'We've got to play better'.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Alex Cora expressed disappointment in the loss, saying 'We had a chance, right? And it was a tie game in the ninth, so we just didn't finish that inning'.
Triston Casas reflected on his costly fielding error, saying 'It hit the grass and then popped up, and I anticipated the next hop being just as high, and it just stayed down'.
Richard Fitts, making his MLB debut, said 'Today was really special, just because I got to share it with my family... Iâ€™m really honored to be a Red Sox today, and hopefully for a long time'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox snapped a tie with a five-run rally against Zack Kelly in the top of the 9th inning.
The Red Sox remained four games behind the Twins in the Wild Card hunt.
The Twins were swept in Kansas City this weekend, so the Red Sox stayed in range of the Wild Card spot.
Boston's starting pitching has rebounded nicely, but the offense, bullpen, and defense continue to be trouble spots.
